</image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;1da05670.1503">   <title>Research to assess the nature and annual value of student start-ups </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;1da05670.1503</link>   <description> Research to assess the nature and annual value of student start-ups<br><br>A new report summarises exploratory research considering ways to provide evidence on the value of student enterprise, including student start-ups and the contribution of students to spin-outs, from English HEIs.<br><br>The findings confirm HEFCE's knowledge exchange funding supports student entrepreneurship and show that studying engineering and art and design-related subjects led to enterprise pathways in over half of start-ups. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T17:08:26+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robert Stewart (HEFCE)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;1da05670.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;833102c8.1503">   <title>Reminder: Quality assessment review plenary session in York on 20 March 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;833102c8.1503</link>   <description> Reminder: Quality assessment review plenary session in York on 20 March 2015<br>In October 2014, the funding bodies in England, Wales and Northern Ireland announced that they were to jointly undertake a review of quality assessment arrangements.<br>HEFCE published and invited comments to the Quality Assessment Review Steering Group's (QARSG) discussion document in January/February 2015. A series of roundtable discussions have also been held to to discuss the high-level issues that will shape future quality assessment arrangements with the sector and other stakeholders.<br>As part of this first phase of sector engagement we are holding a quality assessment review plenary [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T13:57:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robert Stewart (HEFCE)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;833102c8.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;7d9c0815.1503">   <title>Updated guidance for sponsors on applying for and renewing a Tier 4 sponsor licence </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;7d9c0815.1503</link>   <description> Updated guidance for sponsors on applying for and renewing a Tier 4 sponsor licence<br><br>UK Visas and Immigration have published updated guidance for sponsors on applying for and renewing a Tier 4 sponsor licence. This includes clarified guidance on how Tier 4 sponsor licences can be structured when working across multiple sites and campus locations and with partners when delivering higher education provision that we anticipate will be of interest to institutions. Transitional arrangements have been put in place for sponsors with existing Tier 4 licences to ensure they are compliant with the updated guidance, with action required in April/May [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T12:04:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robert Stewart (HEFCE)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;7d9c0815.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;2c59048e.1503">   <title>Changes to the HEFCE website </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;2c59048e.1503</link>   <description> Today we have introduced some changes to our website. The main differences from the old site are:<br><br>* the design is new<br>* the main sections now reflect HEFCE's new business plan<br>* the layout and structure of pages has changed<br>* the site works better across different mobile devices.<br>The extranet is unaffected by these changes.<br>If your institution's website links to HEFCE's site there may be a need to update your site's pages. See below for a breakdown of the new locations and contact us at websitefeedback@hefce.ac.uk&lt;mailto:websitefeedback@hefce.ac.uk&gt; if you have any questions or feedback.<br>'Regulation' [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T07:45:46+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Shelley Hollingsworth (HEFCE)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;2c59048e.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;53adf40b.1503">   <title>Blog post: Opening the Secret Garden \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd a journey into tertiary education</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;53adf40b.1503</link>   <description> Blog post: Opening the Secret Garden \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd a journey into tertiary education<br><br>The Association of Colleges’ (AoC) annual HE conference is one of the main opportunities in the year to consider the important role college-based higher education plays within the HE system. In the months ahead of a general election \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd where the provision of higher technical skills and cost of higher education seem set to play a major part \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd this was an excellent opportunity to hear from experts in the field, and from politicians, on the likely shape of colleges’ contribution to tertiary education in the coming years. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T10:18:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robert Stewart (HEFCE)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;53adf40b.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item million by the HEFCE Catalyst Fund to enhance the learning of higher education students in colleges.<br>http://www.hefce.ac.uk/news/newsarchive/2015/name,102089,en.html<br><br>Blog posts<br><br>The Honour<br>http://www.hefce.ac.uk/pubs/year/2015/cl012015/ [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-06T17:19:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robert Stewart (HEFCE)</dc:creator> <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;e2db0302.1503</link>   <description> Quality assessment review plenary session<br>In October 2014, the funding bodies in England, Wales and Northern Ireland announced that they were to jointly undertake a review of quality assessment arrangements.<br>HEFCE published and invited comments to the Quality Assessment Review Steering Group's (QARSG) discussion document in January/February 2015. A series of roundtable discussions have also been held to to discuss the high-level issues that will shape future quality assessment arrangements with the sector and other stakeholders.<br>As part of this first phase of sector engagement we are holding a quality assessment review plenary session in York on 20 March 2015 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T11:30:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robert Stewart (HEFCE)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;e2db0302.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;97ec506a.1503">   <title>BIS consultation: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdAlternative Providers of Higher Education: Improving Quality and Value for Money\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd responses by 27 March 2015</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;97ec506a.1503</link>   <description> The Department for Business, Innovation and Skills (BIS) has issued a consultation ‘Alternative Providers of Higher Education: Improving Quality and Value for Money’.<br><br>The consultation asks about some key issues and will be of particular interest to HEFCE funded providers that deliver franchise provision in partnership with alternative providers.<br><br>Note that BIS is seeking responses by 27 March 2015. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T07:52:49+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Shelley Hollingsworth (HEFCE)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;97ec506a.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;d9d96c0b.1503">   <title>Blog post: The MENA University Summit </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;d9d96c0b.1503</link>   <description> Blog post: The MENA University Summit<br><br>The title of oldest university in the world is a contested one, but both the Guinness Book of Records and UNESCO agree that the title goes to the University of al-Qarawiyyin in Morocco, which was founded in 859, some two centuries before the foundation of the University of Bologna. With this, and other ancient seats of learning, the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region has a rich history of higher education. Last week, leaders from universities in this region gathered in Doha, Qatar to consider one of the most recent trends in HE [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T11:59:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robert Stewart (HEFCE)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;d9d96c0b.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;e8779fd6.1502</link>   <description> Information published on the HEFCE web-site 23-27 February 2015:<br><br>News<br>Steve Egan appointed to senior post at the University of Bath<br>Steve Egan, Deputy Chief Executive and Director of Finance at HEFCE, has been appointed to the post of Vice-President (Implementation) at the University of Bath with effect from 1 May 2015.<br>http://www.hefce.ac.uk/news/newsarchive/2015/name,101339,en.html<br><br>New HEFCE report shines further light on young participation in higher education<br>New HEFCE research looks at how many young people go on to higher education from A-levels and similar Level 3 qualifications.<br>http://www.hefce.ac.uk/news/newsarchive/2015/name,101897,en.html [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T14:56:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>p.foster@hefce.ac.uk</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;e8779fd6.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;d04bcde9.1502">   <title>STEM accreditation reviews launched </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;d04bcde9.1502</link>   <description> STEM accreditation reviews launched<br><br>The announcement of the Government's science and innovation strategy in December included a commission to establish a general review of science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) and a specific review of computer science degree accreditation arrangements. The reviews will explore issues around graduate employability and consider options for how they could be addressed. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-26T11:12:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>p.foster@hefce.ac.uk</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;d04bcde9.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;29cbb36b.1502">   <title>New HEFCE report shines further light on young participation in higher education </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;29cbb36b.1502</link>   <description> New HEFCE report shines further light on young participation in higher education<br><br>The report, 'Young participation in higher education: A-levels and similar qualifications' (HEFCE 2015/03), examines the rates of young participation in higher education for all Key Stage 5 pupils from English schools and colleges achieving a Level 3 qualification between 2006 and 2013. It also examines the extent to which a pupil's school and background affect their likelihood of progressing to higher education at the ages of 18 or 19. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-26T09:12:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>p.foster@hefce.ac.uk</dc:creator> rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;c7d3d3ee.1502">   <title>Blog post: Global demand for English higher education \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd back on track?</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;c7d3d3ee.1502</link>   <description> Blog post: Global demand for English higher education \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd back on track?<br><br>At first glance of the Higher Education Statistical Agency’s data on student enrolments for 2013-14 I breathed a great sigh of relief. International student demand is showing strong signs of recovery. The numbers of EU students look positive, although levels are still below those in 2010. Demand from India seems to have levelled off at undergraduate level and there’s almost no change in student numbers from Pakistan. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T10:55:37+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robert Stewart (HEFCE)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;c7d3d3ee.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;388bba86.1502">   <title>Global demand for English higher education: Latest shifts and trends </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;388bba86.1502</link>   <description> The latest international student enrolment figures show signs of recovery in global demand for English higher education. This report examines the latest shifts in enrolments of international students and aims to understand how sustainable the growth in demand is.<br><br>Read the report at http://www.hefce.ac.uk/pubs/year/2015/201502/<br><br>Anyone can join or leave &lt;https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?SUBED1=admin-hefce&amp;A=1&gt; this list at any time.    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-18T11:00:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Philip Purser-Hallard (HEFCE)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;388bba86.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;1e399d15.1502">   <title>'PGT Choices' toolkit: Update on provision of guidance for prospective postgraduates </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;1e399d15.1502</link>   <description> 'PGT Choices' toolkit: Update on provision of guidance for prospective postgraduates<br><br>Last April we announced we would launch an online tool to support decision-making by prospective PGT students in 2015. The tool will help prospective students identify questions to ask when deciding what and where to study, and to signpost them to sources of relevant information. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-17T15:43:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Shelley Hollingsworth (HEFCE)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;1e399d15.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;49822128.1502">   <title>Blog post: How does the sector support student engagement and enhance students\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd learning experiences?</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;49822128.1502</link>   <description> Blog post: How does the sector support student engagement and enhance students’ learning experiences?<br><br>Ellie Clewlow, HEFCE's Head of Learning and Teaching, reflects on discussions at a recent event for learning and teaching leaders and practitioners.<br><br>To read this post in full visit: http://blog.hefce.ac.uk/2015/02/16/how-does-the-sector-support-student-engagement-and-enhance-students-learning-experiences/    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-16T10:16:37+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robert Stewart (HEFCE)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;49822128.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;65aff83c.1502">   <title>Information published on the HEFCE web-site 9-13 February 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;65aff83c.1502</link>   <description> Information published on the HEFCE web-site 9-13 February 2015:<br><br>Web updates<br><br>Research and evaluation in progress<br>An update on the HEFCE-commissioned projects that are in </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;ddd102b1.1502</link>   <description> The future of quality assessment in higher education: what approaches do other sectors and countries take?<br><br>HEFCE has published two studies to support our discussion with stakeholders about future approaches to quality assessment.<br><br>HEFCE, together with the funding bodies in Wales and Northern Ireland, is undertaking a review of future approaches to quality assessment in higher education. In January we published a wide-ranging discussion document which asks important questions of higher education providers, of students, of employers, and of other stakeholders about what quality assessment arrangements should be like in the future. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T09:28:13+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Shelley Hollingsworth (HEFCE)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;ddd102b1.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;6d74a8bd.1502">   <title>Further education colleges applying to become directly HEFCE funded: future quality requirements </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADMIN-HEFCE;6d74a8bd.1502</link>   <description> Further education colleges applying to become directly HEFCE funded: future quality requirements<br><br>From now on, HEFCE will only accept applications from colleges who wish to become directly funded if they have a recent and successful Quality Assessment Review conducted by the Quality Assurance Agency for Higher Education (QAA).
